availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William H. H. Taylor (Cincinnati, Ohio, Merchant, Colonel USA)

body.p: Cincinnati, Hamilton County, Ohio, merchant, and colonel in the 5th Ohio Volunteer Cavalry. Ohio native. Married to Catherine Taylor. Employed Mary Egan in 1860. Merchant in Cincinnati, Hamilton County, Ohio, in 1860. Colonel of the 5th Ohio Volunteer Cavalry (U.S.A.) from 1861 to 1865.

ab.bibl:
Find A Grave, "William H. H. Taylor (1827-1908)," Memorial #17923680, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/17923680 (accessed October 08, 2018).
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Cincinnati Ward 14, p. 343.
Civil War in Ohio "5th Ohio Cavalry by Larry Stephens," http://www.ohiocivilwar.com/cwc5.html
Edwin Bearss, Unvexed to the Sea: The Vicksburg Campaign, Volume III, 1995 (New York: Morningside House Inc), p.1141.
